results.title: Bowlers (S)
results.creator_credit: John Phillips, Benson and Hedges Overseas and Tripod Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Benson and Hedges golden greats of cricket”.
A comprehensive history of the game of cricket tracing the game’s development from the early nineteenth century to the present. This second part traces the careers of the world’s best bowlers including Frank Woolley, Richie Benaud, Prasanna Abdul Qadir, Frank Tyson, Jeff Thomson, Dennis Lillee, Imran Khan, Courtney Walsh and Curtly Ambrose. Includes footage from the world’s largest cricket and /or media libraries
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Phillips, Benson and Hedges Overseas and Tripod Films

results.title: Batsmen (S)
results.creator_credit: Andrew Gillman, David Puttnam and Visnews Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Benson and Hedges golden greats of cricket”.
A comprehensive history of the game of cricket tracing the games’ development from the early nineteenth century to the present. The first part examines the careers of the most reknowned of international cricket batsmen including W. G. Grace, George Headley, Leonard Hutton, Bradman, Kapi Dev, Clive Lloyd, Ian Botham and Viv Richards. The video uses archival and television footage from the largest cricket and/or media libraries in the world.

results.title: R. O'Hara Burke
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Behind the Legend”.
Presents a dramatized reenactment of the events surrounding Robert O’Hara Burke through the memories of his friends. Aspects of his life, the Burke and Wills Expedition and his death are reconstructed. Introduced by Manning Clark and written by Thomas Keneally. Cast includes Tony Allyn as Burke, Cornelia Frances, Ian Nimmo, Richard Lupina, Don Philps, David Williams, Clive Marshall and Shirley Sunners.

results.title: F.H. Greenway
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Behind the Legend”.
Introduced by Manning Clarke, the film proficiently reconstructs the story of Francis Greenway’s relationship and court case with Edward Sanderson of the N.S.W. Corps, and gives glimpses of the conditions in the colony under the Governorship of Macquarie. Written by Joanne Bean, the cast includes John Ewart as Francis Greenway and Nick Tate as Captain Sanderson.

results.title: Wm Bligh
results.creator_credit: John Croyston, Alan Burke, ABC and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Behind the Legend”.
Presents a dramatized re-enactment of the events surrounding the arrest of Governor William Bligh by the New South Wales Corps in 1808. Various witnesses present their accounts of cowardice and misappropriation by Bligh. Introduced by Manning Clark and written by Thomas Keneally. Cast includes Brian James as Bligh, Peter Gwynne, Richard Meikle, Kevin Leslie, John Trenaman, Robyn Nevin.

results.title: Generalisation, discrimination and motivation (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Behaviour Theory in Practice”.
Stresses methods of conditioning by reinforcing operant behaviour. Demonstrates motivation by positive reinforcement, conditioning reinforcement, punishment, negative reinforcement, avoidance and control self-simulation, in laboratory experiments and other learning situations. Compares the efficacy of praise and other positive reinforcements to punishment and negative reinforcements.

results.title: Respondent and operant behaviour (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Behaviour Theory in Practice”.
Defines respondent and operant behaviour and shows laboratory experiments with mice, pigeons etc. illustrating biological and non- biological reinforcers and conditioning. Dogs and children demonstrate learned responses. Narrated by Jack K. Burton.

results.title: Shaping various operants, various species (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ellen Reese and Charter Oak Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Behaviour Theory in Practice”.
Considers conditioning in six steps: shaping, adaptation, situation, motivation, operant level and final performance. These are illustrated by conditioned lever pressing by rats, high jumping by dogs, manipulation of a talking parrot and learning of handwriting by children.
